page.title: 01A review of block 04280258
page.content: This block of Central Warwicksire is totally rural in nature containing no settlements at all.Therefore it contains very few amenities and farming is the dominant activity. The farming is of a mixed nature with the arable land usually given over to corn crops and the pasture to beef cattle and sheep. The soil is of a clayey nature and is generally fertile. The landscape is gently rolling, while the field pattern largely retains its 18th century character, although there has been some field amalgamation. The block also contains a large deciduous woodland, Oakley Wood, that is actively forested. Trees as they are harvested are replaced by saplings.
